content.question: Let <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> be polynomial functions given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3 x to the power of 4 plus 2 x squared minus 5 x plus 1"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals x squared plus x plus 1"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. What is the remainder when <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is divided by <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> ?

topic.text: 1.11: Equivalent Representations of Polynomial and Rational Expressions

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
